articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken flew to Egypt on Tuesday, pushing for areas of possible progress on a Gaza ceasefire and hostage release deal in talks planned for later this week, with major areas of dispute left unresolved.
articles.title: Blinken in Egypt seeking progress towards ceasefire Gaza deal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Rescue teams were getting ready in Sicily to resume a search for six missing people, including British tech entrepreneur Mike Lynch and his daughter, after a luxury yacht was struck by a violent storm and sank on Monday, killing one on board.
articles.title: After yacht sinks off Sicily, search continues for six missing

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Jeff Mason
articles.description: Former U.S. President Barack Obama will endorse his longtime political ally Kamala Harris on Tuesday night in a high-profile speech that aims to boost her presidential bid over Republican Donald Trump.
articles.title: DNC Tuesday: Obama the headliner, will campaign for Harris

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A World Health Organization official stressed on Tuesday that mpox, regardless of whether it is the new or old strain, is not the new COVID, as authorities know how to control its spread.
articles.title: Mpox is not the new COVID, says WHO official

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's military said its forces had come under multiple Russian attacks over the course of Tuesday on the Toretsk and Pokrovsk fronts in eastern Ukraine.
articles.title: Kyiv says its forces under heavy Russian attack in east Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian lawmakers on Tuesday paved the way for a ban against a Russia-linked minority Ukrainian Orthodox Church which Kyiv has cast as complicit in Moscow's invasion of Ukraine.
articles.title: Ukraine adopts law paving way for ban of Russia-linked minority church

articles.author: Eliana Raszewski, Walter Bianchi
articles.description: Argentine authorities have quarantined a cargo ship in the Parana River near the inland grains port of Rosario over a suspected case of mpox onboard, an industry official said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Argentina quarantines grains ship over suspected mpox case

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Nandita Bose
articles.description: U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris' election effort has raised around $500 million since she became the Democratic presidential candidate, sources told Reuters, an unprecedented money haul that reflects donor enthusiasm going into the Nov. 5 election.
articles.title: Exclusive: Harris' election effort raises around $500 million in a month, sources say

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Derek Chauvin has been transferred to a prison in Texas, the U.S. Federal Bureau of Prisons said on Tuesday, nine months after the former Minneapolis police officer convicted in the death of George Floyd survived a prison stabbing in Arizona.
articles.title: George Floyd killer Derek Chauvin transferred to Texas prison

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden approved in March a highly classified nuclear strategic plan that for the first time reoriented Washington's deterrent strategy on China's expansion of its nuclear arsenal, the New York Times reported on Tuesday.
articles.title: Biden approved secret nuclear strategy focusing on Chinese threat, New York Times reports
